documentation.text:
@notice the borrow interest rate calculation
 Borrow interest rate(%)
  ^
  |             |    /
  |             |   /
  |             |  /<------ rate slope 2
  |             | /
  |         ____|/
  |    ____/    |
  | __/<--------|-------- rate slope 1
  |/<-----------|-------- base borrow rate
  |-------------|------|  Utilization rate(%)
  0             80    100
               ^   ^
               |   | excess utilization rate
               | optimal utilization rate
 When the utilization rate is too high (over 80%) the the pool will use rate slope 2 to calculate
 the borrow interest rate which grow very fast to protect the liquidity in the pool.

@dev get base borrow rate of the ERC20 token pool
 @return base borrow rate

@dev calculate the annual interest rate based on utilization rate
 @param _totalBorrows the total borrows of the ERC20 token pool
 @param _totalLiquidity the total liquidity of the ERC20 token of the pool
 First, calculate the utilization rate as below formula
 utilization rate = total borrows / (total borrows + available liquidity)
 Second, calculate the annual interest rate
 As the above graph which show the relative between the utilization rate and the borrow interest rate.
 There are 2 cases:
 1. the utilization rate is less than or equal 80%
 - the borrow interest rate = base borrow rate + (utilization rate * rate slope 1 / optimal utilization rate)
 2. the utilization rate is excessed 80%. In this case the borrow interest rate will be very high.
 - the excess utilization rate ratio = (utilization rate - optimal utilization rate) / excess utilization rate
 - the borrow interest rate = base borrow rate + rate slope 1 + (rate slope 2 * excess utilization rate ratio)

@dev get optimal utilization rate of the ERC20 token pool
 @return the optimal utilization

  ^
  |             |    /
  |             |   /
  |             |  /<------ rate slope 2
  |             | /
  |         ____|/
  |    ____/    |
  | __/<--------|-------- rate slope 1
  |/<-----------|-------- base borrow rate
  |-------------|------|  Utilization rate(%)
  0             80    100
               ^   ^
               |   | excess utilization rate
               | optimal utilization rate
 When the utilization rate is too high (over 80%) the the pool will use rate slope 2 to calculate
 the borrow interest rate which grow very fast to protect the liquidity in the pool.

@dev get base borrow rate of the ERC20 token pool
 @return base borrow rate

@dev calculate the annual interest rate based on utilization rate
 @param _totalBorrows the total borrows of the ERC20 token pool
 @param _totalLiquidity the total liquidity of the ERC20 token of the pool
 First, calculate the utilization rate as below formula
 utilization rate = total borrows / (total borrows + available liquidity)
 Second, calculate the annual interest rate
 As the above graph which show the relative between the utilization rate and the borrow interest rate.
 There are 2 cases:
 1. the utilization rate is less than or equal 80%
 - the borrow interest rate = base borrow rate + (utilization rate * rate slope 1 / optimal utilization rate)
 2. the utilization rate is excessed 80%. In this case the borrow interest rate will be very high.
 - the excess utilization rate ratio = (utilization rate - optimal utilization rate) / excess utilization rate
 - the borrow interest rate = base borrow rate + rate slope 1 + (rate slope 2 * excess utilization rate ratio)

@dev get optimal utilization rate of the ERC20 token pool
 @return the optimal utilization

calculateInterestRate(uint256,uint256).details: calculate the annual interest rate based on utilization rate

params._totalBorrows: the total borrows of the ERC20 token pool
params._totalLiquidity: the total liquidity of the ERC20 token of the pool First, calculate the utilization rate as below formula utilization rate = total borrows / (total borrows + available liquidity) Second, calculate the annual interest rate As the above graph which show the relative between the utilization rate and the borrow interest rate. There are 2 cases: 1. the utilization rate is less than or equal 80% - the borrow interest rate = base borrow rate + (utilization rate * rate slope 1 / optimal utilization rate) 2. the utilization rate is excessed 80%. In this case the borrow interest rate will be very high. - the excess utilization rate ratio = (utilization rate - optimal utilization rate) / excess utilization rate - the borrow interest rate = base borrow rate + rate slope 1 + (rate slope 2 * excess utilization rate ratio)

getBaseBorrowRate().details: get base borrow rate of the ERC20 token pool

getCollateralPercent().details: get collateral percent of the ERC20 token pool

returns._0: collateral percent Basically the collateral percent is the percent that liquidity can be use as collteral to cover the user's loan

getLiquidationBonusPercent().details: get the liquidation bonus of the ERC20 token pool

returns._0: liquidation bonus percent the liquidation bunus percent used for collateral amount calculation. How many collateral that liquidator will receive when the liquidation is success.

getOptimalUtilizationRate().details: get optimal utilization rate of the ERC20 token pool

params._totalBorrows: the total borrows of the ERC20 token pool
params._totalLiquidity: the total liquidity of the ERC20 token of the pool

returns._0: utilizationRate the utilization rate of the ERC20 pool

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

baseBorrowRate().notice: the borrow interest rate calculation Borrow interest rate(%)  ^  |             |    /  |             |   /  |             |  /<------ rate slope 2  |             | /  |         ____|/  |    ____/    |  | __/<--------|-------- rate slope 1  |/<-----------|-------- base borrow rate  |-------------|------|  Utilization rate(%)  0             80    100               ^   ^               |   | excess utilization rate               | optimal utilization rate When the utilization rate is too high (over 80%) the the pool will use rate slope 2 to calculate the borrow interest rate which grow very fast to protect the liquidity in the pool.

userdoc.notice: Implements the configuration of the ERC20 token pool.
